title: 3B-CS-01
description: Categorize the roles of operating system software. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-CS-02
description: Illustrate ways computing systems implement logic, input, and output through hardware components. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-NI-03
description: Describe the issues that impact network functionality (e.g., bandwidth, load, delay, topology). (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-NI-04
description: Compare ways software developers protect devices and information from unauthorized access. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-DA-05
description: Use data analysis tools and techniques to identify patterns in data representing complex systems. (P. 4.1)

title: 3B-DA-06
description: Select data collection tools and techniques to generate data sets that support a claim or communicate information. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-DA-07
description: Evaluate the ability of models and simulations to test and support the refinement of hypotheses. (P. 4.4)

title: 3B-AP-08
description: Describe how artificial intelligence drives many software and physical systems. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-AP-09
description: Implement an artificial intelligence algorithm to play a game against a human opponent or solve a problem. (P. 5.3)

title: 3B-AP-10
description: Use and adapt classic algorithms to solve computational problems. (P. 4.2)

title: 3B-AP-11
description: Evaluate algorithms in terms of their efficiency, correctness, and clarity. (P. 4.2)

title: 3B-AP-12
description: Compare and contrast fundamental data structures and their uses. (P. 4.2)

title: 3B-AP-13
description: Illustrate the flow of execution of a recursive algorithm. (P. 3.2)

title: 3B-AP-14
description: Construct solutions to problems using student-created components, such as procedures, modules and/or objects. (P. 5.2)

title: 3B-AP-15
description: Analyze a large-scale computational problem and identify generalizable patterns that can be applied to a solution. (P. 4.1)

title: 3B-AP-16
description: Demonstrate code reuse by creating programming solutions using libraries and APIs. (P. 5.3)

title: 3B-AP-17
description: Plan and develop programs for broad audiences using a software lifecycle process. (P. 5.1)

title: 3B-AP-18
description: Explain security issues that might lead to compromised computer programs. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-AP-19
description: Develop programs for multiple computing platforms. (P. 5.2)

title: 3B-AP-20
description: Use version control systems, integrated development environments (IDEs), and collaborative tools and practices (code documentation) in a group software project. (P. 2.4)

title: 3B-AP-21
description: Develop and use a series of test cases to verify that a program performs according to its design specifications. (P. 6.1)

title: 3B-AP-22
description: Modify an existing program to add additional functionality and discuss intended and unintended implications (e.g., breaking other functionality). (P. 5.3)

title: 3B-AP-23
description: Evaluate key qualities of a program through a process such as a code review. (P. 6.3)

title: 3B-AP-24
description: Compare multiple programming languages and discuss how their features make them suitable for solving different types of problems. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-IC-25
description: Evaluate computational artifacts to maximize their beneficial effects and minimize harmful effects on society. (P. 6.1, P. 1.2)

title: 3B-IC-26
description: Evaluate the impact of equity, access, and influence on the distribution of computing resources in a global society. (P. 1.2)

title: 3B-IC-27
description: Predict how computational innovations that have revolutionized aspects of our culture might evolve. (P. 7.2)

title: 3B-IC-28
description: Debate laws and regulations that impact the development and use of software. (P. 3.3, P. 7.3)
